name: Maritime War Cake
author: Linda S.
summary: This eggless cake was developed by resourceful cooks during the war when eggs, butter, and milk were rationed. It is a traditional Christmas cake here on the East Coast of Canada. Served with a nice big hunk of Cheddar cheese and a hot cup of tea, it is a real holiday treat!
directions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Grease and flour a round tube pan or two loaf pans
Bring water, raisins, molasses, sugar, and shortening to a boil in a saucepan; reduce heat to low and simmer until raisins are plump, about 5 minutes
Whisk flour, baking soda, and cinnamon together in a bowl
Stir flour mixture into raisin mixture until well combined; pour into prepared baking pan
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean, about 1 hour
